alert.note: Alert for Lancaster; York (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued September 12 at 3:06PM EDT until September 12 at 10:00PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of central Pennsylvania, including the following counties, Lancaster and York. * WHEN...Until 11 PM EDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Heavy rainfall rates exceeding 2 inches per hour at times could produce localized rainfall amounts of 2 to 3 inches over a short duration. Flash flooding is most likely to occur with repeat storms atop the most saturated soils or in more urban/impermeable areas. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.
